definitions: in a favorable or advantageous way; so as to have a good effect

examples.text: we are privileged to beneficially affect the lives of tens of thousands of children every day

shortDefinitions: so as to have good effect

definitions: in a way that relates to rights to the use or benefit of property, other than legal title

examples.text: the holder and its affiliates would beneficially own more than 4.99% of the total number of ordinary shares

shortDefinitions: in way that relates to rights to use or benefit of property
